newsitem.title: EGYPT: SQUASH-JANSHER BEATS PARKE IN QUARTERS.
newsitem.headline: SQUASH-JANSHER BEATS PARKE IN QUARTERS.

text.p: World champion Jansher Khan moved a step closer a successful defence of his Al Ahram International squash title on Sunday night when he beat English seventh seed Simon Parke 15-11 15-5 5-15 15-13.
The Pakistani, who dropped the third game of the quarter-final contest in just three hands from 2-1, recovered to take the fourth game narrowly on a weak, tired forehand onto the tin by Parke.
But Jansher was full of praise for his rival. "Simon played very well and showed that he is back among the top group," Jansher said.
In the women's singles, second-seeded Australian Michelle Martin brushed past Jane Martin of England 9-3 9-5 9-2 to become thethird from her country to reach the last four.
